description: The largest of all flying parrot species, the Hyacinth Macaw is a breathtaking solid cobalt blue, with bright yellow patches of bare skin around its eyes and at the base of its beak.
size: Up to 40 inches (100 cm). Weight: 1200-1700g (42-60 oz)
temperament: Famously known as 'gentle giants.' They are exceptionally gentle, sweet-natured, and even-tempered. They are highly intelligent and playful but not as prone to nippiness as other macaws.
loudness: Extremely Loud. Their calls are deep, guttural, and can travel for miles. They are among the loudest of all parrots.
vocalization: Can learn to talk, but they are not known for extensive vocabularies or clarity. Their vocalizations are more often loud, throaty squawks.
dietaryNeeds: A highly specialized diet is required. They need a diet very high in fat and calories, consisting of macadamia nuts, Brazil nuts, walnuts, and specialized pellets.
healthPointers: Can live up to 60 years. Susceptible to PDD. Their massive beaks require a constant supply of extremely hard, durable toys and nuts to maintain their condition.
housing: Requires a custom-built, exceptionally large, and strong enclosure, ideally a walk-in aviary. A standard cage will not suffice. Absolutely unsuitable for apartments.
